Why bother with SMO questions when they are generally not inherently interesting? Better to learn more serious stuff

Everytime I talk to a mathematician involved with olympiads  they go  we know that this is not 'real' mathematics  but this is just for fun and to try to get people interested in mathematics.  To them if they give 'real' mathematics to younger students they might be disinterested.
I would draw the parallel to competitive programming and never really needing to ever use those algorithms ever in day to day use
But it's a good brain teaser kind of thing
I just went for it becus it was free and would give me cca points idk lol
U will never use cauchy schwarz in ur national exams
Its not in syllabus theres no ordered points in syllabus
but the way you think and approach the question  i think that's a valuable skill that people will look at
Yeah but olympaids don't help increase your grades for your O/A level subjects
Most people won‚Äôt touch that though

One of them was my Cambridge interviewer. Told me he knows it's not real mathematics but just to get people interested. When he mentioned olympiads and the expression on my face he knew I didn't like it. He seems to hate olympiads himself
Not quite the mathematician way though
I think most people do it for the points
We like to think if things work in a more general case
It's not like olympiads which is very computational heavy
Did u sit for last year paper?
Rigour? It's not even rigourous when you just give answers and not the full proof
Yeah it's not really that rigorous to be honest
From my experience with A levels and SMO  I think A levels can be more rigourous in certain aspects  as in proving things for some general case
SMO questions u dont need working  so you can use unconventional methods  like drawing the thing to scale
I mean I suck so I cant go for paper 2
No. That means SMO is nonsense
But SMO they dont really teach u problem solving they teach u tricks
Exactly. So why bother and claim you suck when you are comparing yourself to some nonsense?
I mean I suck at the paper
Some teachers at school have this false illusion that mathematics olympiads really test your skills
That's what I'm trying to say
Well  if you like then you do it  don't really see a concrete reason to downplay olympiad.I honestly don't get the purpose of this argument.
It doesn't test math as per se  but more like logic
As someone who does both Olympiad Math and higher-level math  I think they somewhat complement each other
For SMO R1  yeah most of the time its tricks that'll get you the answer and you're at a disadvantage if you try to do every question legit
thats just a consequence of R1 format
But R2 questions and IMO shortlist questions and whatnot generally require more than just tricks to do.
Thats my take on it at least
